notes: Synthetic supplier memory fixtures for WTG+LTSA negotiation MVP. Not based on real suppliers.

suppliers.name: Battila Turbines
typical_tactics: bundle service scope to defend headline price
successful_trades: extend LTSA term (years) in exchange for lower uplift
increase planned spares scope to secure better service pricing
commit to condition monitoring data sharing to gain availability improvement
sensitive_points: resists stronger delay LD caps without compensation
pushes back on broad consequential damages language
prefers flexible delivery windows once slot reserved

episodes.context: WTG+LTSA, North Sea, new build, slot reserved late
episodes.primary_trade_used: extend LTSA term by 2 years
episodes.notes: Supplier agreed to reduce uplift when service term extended; pushed slot deadline hard.

episodes.context: WTG supply only, Baltic, competitive tender
episodes.primary_trade_used: earlier milestone payment (manufacturing start)
episodes.notes: Payment acceleration helped, but supplier held firm on part of uplift citing materials.

episodes.context: LTSA renewal, North Sea, availability underperformance discussion
episodes.primary_trade_used: service scope adjustment (planned maintenance window flexibility)
episodes.notes: Supplier traded lower uplift for more flexible maintenance scheduling and fewer penalties.

episodes.context: WTG+LTSA, floating pilot, warranty clarification
episodes.primary_trade_used: limit expanded warranty carve-outs (mutual)
episodes.notes: Supplier demanded higher uplift due to perceived technical risk; buyer accepted with tighter warranty wording.

episodes.context: WTG+LTSA, North Sea, schedule risk allocation
episodes.primary_trade_used: remove aggressive delay LD step-up; replace with capped LD + recovery plan
episodes.notes: Supplier moved when LD structure became more predictable; uplift reduced materially.

episodes.context: WTG+LTSA, Baltic, spares package included
episodes.primary_trade_used: increase spares scope (critical components)
episodes.notes: Supplier lowered uplift in exchange for expanded spares package and simplified service response SLAs.

episodes.context: WTG supply, North Sea, currency risk discussion
episodes.primary_trade_used: invoice currency alignment + hedging assumption clarified
episodes.notes: Supplier accepted a partial reduction once FX exposure clarified; still held some uplift.

episodes.context: LTSA add-on, North Sea, additional condition monitoring
episodes.primary_trade_used: data access + remote diagnostics rights
episodes.notes: Supplier accepted low uplift when granted a clear data access framework.

episodes.context: WTG+LTSA, North Sea, indexation clause negotiation
episodes.primary_trade_used: indexation cap/floor agreed (predictable)
episodes.notes: Supplier conceded once indexation was capped but allowed limited pass-through with transparency.

episodes.context: WTG+LTSA, Baltic, service credits structure
episodes.primary_trade_used: service credits definition simplified; remedy hierarchy clarified
episodes.notes: Supplier moved after remedy structure became less punitive and more operationally realistic.

suppliers.name: Corealium OEM
typical_tactics: anchor high on headline price uplift
offer discounts only via volume/term commitments
prefer indexation mechanisms over fixed reductions
successful_trades: longer frame agreement / option for phase 2
indexation with cap/floor instead of higher fixed uplift
bundle spares + training for reduced service uplift
sensitive_points: avoids strong performance LDs tied to external factors

episodes.context: WTG+LTSA, North Sea, multi-phase development
episodes.primary_trade_used: phase 2 option commitment (conditional)
episodes.notes: Supplier accepted meaningful reduction when a phase 2 option letter was included.

episodes.context: WTG+LTSA, Baltic, fixed price vs indexation debate
episodes.primary_trade_used: indexation with cap/floor + transparency
episodes.notes: Supplier preferred capped indexation over pushing fixed uplift; buyer gained lower base uplift.

episodes.context: LTSA renewal, North Sea, service pricing reset
episodes.primary_trade_used: bundle spares + technician training for service uplift reduction
episodes.notes: Supplier reduced some uplift but maintained premium for specialist coverage.

episodes.context: WTG supply, North Sea, delivery window tightening
episodes.primary_trade_used: flexible delivery window + limited schedule LDs
episodes.notes: Supplier moved slightly; insisted on flexibility to manage factory loading.

episodes.context: WTG+LTSA, floating pilot, risk premium discussion
episodes.primary_trade_used: scope split (pilot risk separated from base scope)
episodes.notes: Separating pilot risk reduced the premium on the base package.

episodes.context: WTG+LTSA, North Sea, warranty extension request
episodes.primary_trade_used: warranty extension paid via service credit structure
episodes.notes: Supplier held service uplift to fund warranty extension; buyer accepted due to risk posture.

episodes.context: LTSA, North Sea, availability guarantee definition
episodes.primary_trade_used: availability calculation clarified + exclusions narrowed
episodes.notes: Supplier reduced uplift once availability metrics became operationally clearer.

episodes.context: WTG supply, Baltic, payment security discussion
episodes.primary_trade_used: LC (letter of credit) requirement reduced in exchange for milestone discipline
episodes.notes: Supplier traded off security requirements; uplift reduction moderate.

episodes.context: WTG+LTSA, North Sea, service response times
episodes.primary_trade_used: service response tiering (critical vs non-critical)
episodes.notes: Tiering response times reduced supplier cost; they lowered uplift accordingly.

episodes.context: WTG+LTSA, Baltic, end-of-warranty transition
episodes.primary_trade_used: spares replenishment plan + inventory visibility
episodes.notes: Supplier agreed to lower uplift with clearer spares replenishment governance.

suppliers.name: Korulean Services
typical_tactics: strict stance on warranty and liability caps
request risk premiums for tighter guarantees
successful_trades: schedule flexibility in exchange for lower uplift
reduced liability exposure via clearer remedy hierarchy
service scope phased approach (base + option modules)
sensitive_points: strongly resists increased consequential damages exposure
prefers clear exclusions for force majeure

episodes.context: WTG+LTSA, North Sea, liability cap negotiation
episodes.primary_trade_used: clarify remedy hierarchy; keep liability cap stable
episodes.notes: Supplier reduced uplift only after liability language stabilized; still demanded risk premium.

episodes.context: LTSA, Baltic, availability guarantee tightening
episodes.primary_trade_used: availability definition exclusions expanded slightly
episodes.notes: Supplier held price; buyer accepted slightly broader exclusions to avoid higher uplift.

episodes.context: WTG supply, North Sea, schedule LD structure
episodes.primary_trade_used: replace LD step-up with capped LD + recovery plan
episodes.notes: Supplier moved when LD became predictable; schedule flexibility was key.

episodes.context: WTG+LTSA, floating pilot, technical risk premium
episodes.primary_trade_used: split pilot scope + option module for enhanced coverage
episodes.notes: Scope modularization reduced base premium but total cost still high if options chosen.

episodes.context: LTSA renewal, North Sea, payment term request
episodes.primary_trade_used: earlier payment milestone for spare parts stocking
episodes.notes: Supplier moved somewhat on uplift when cashflow improved for spares inventory.

episodes.context: WTG+LTSA, Baltic, force majeure clause debate
episodes.primary_trade_used: force majeure clarified + notice requirements tightened
episodes.notes: Supplier accepted reduction after FM became clearer and less open-ended.

episodes.context: WTG supply, North Sea, commissioning support scope
episodes.primary_trade_used: reduce on-site support days; add remote support
episodes.notes: Operational scope optimization enabled supplier to reduce uplift.

episodes.context: LTSA, North Sea, service credits structure
episodes.primary_trade_used: service credits capped; escalation path clarified
episodes.notes: Supplier resisted broader service credits; buyer accepted cap to reduce friction.

episodes.context: WTG+LTSA, Baltic, spare parts lead time penalties
episodes.primary_trade_used: penalties replaced with KPI reporting + improvement plan
episodes.notes: Supplier moved once penalties became process-based rather than financial.

episodes.context: WTG+LTSA, North Sea, warranty exclusions negotiation
episodes.primary_trade_used: narrow a subset of exclusions; keep cap stable
episodes.notes: Supplier traded only small improvements; remained strict on liability.
